title: An Optimal Control Strategy for Execution of Large Stock Orders Using LSTMs. (arXiv:2301.09705v3 [q-fin.CP] UPDATED)
abstract: In this paper, we simulate the execution of a large stock order with real data and general power law in the Almgren and Chriss model. The example that we consider is the liquidation of a large position executed over the course of a single trading day in a limit order book. Transaction costs are incurred because large orders walk the order book, that is, they consume order book liquidity beyond the best bid/ask. We model the order book with a power law that is proportional to trading volume, and thus transaction costs are inversely proportional to a power of trading volume. We obtain a policy approximation by training a long short term memory (LSTM) neural network to minimize transaction costs accumulated when execution is carried out as a sequence of smaller suborders. Using historical S&P100 price and volume data, we evaluate our LSTM strategy relative to strategies based on time-weighted average price (TWAP) and volume-weighted average price (VWAP). translated_abstract: 本文利用实际数据和Almgren和Chriss模型中的一般幂律模拟了大型股票订单的执行。我们考虑的示例是在限价订单簿中，在单个交易日内执行大量头寸的清算。由于大订单会在订单簿上移动，即超出最佳买入/卖出价格，因此会产生交易成本。我们使用与交易量成比例的幂律来建模订单簿，因此交易成本与交易量的幂成反比。我们通过训练长短期记忆（LSTM）神经网络来获得策略近似，以最小化按较小的子订单序列执行时累计的交易成本。使用历史的S&P100价格和成交量数据，我们相对于基于时间加权平均价格（TWAP）和基于成交量加权平均价格（VWAP）的策略来评估我们的LSTM策略。
tldr: 本文介绍了一种使用LSTM神经网络实现大型股票订单最优控制策略的方法，通过最小化交易成本来执行一系列小订单，具有良好的实验效果。
en_tdlr: This paper presents a method for optimal control of large stock orders using LSTM neural network which minimizes transaction costs by executing a sequence of smaller suborders and has good experimental results.
